alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lincoln; Ouachita; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 3:56PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Jackson, southeastern Union, central Ouachita and southeastern Lincoln Parishes through 445 PM CST... At 355 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ruston, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Ruston, Claiborne, West Monroe, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Richwood, Choudrant, Downsville, Drew, Calhoun, Loch Lomon, Folksville, Cheniere, Rocky Branch, Mineral Springs, Caderville, Pine Grove and Eureka. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central Louisiana.
